meanings.definition: The period of time before written records.
meanings.sent1: In prehistory, people did not have books or letters to write down what happened.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists study prehistory to learn about ancient civilizations that existed before writing was invented.
meanings.sent3: During a game of charades, my friend tried to act out prehistory by pretending to write on an invisible tablet.
meanings.sent4: The mysteries of prehistory are like buried treasures waiting to be uncovered by curious minds.
meanings.sent5: Imagine prehistory as a giant jigsaw puzzle with missing pieces that historians are trying to find.

meanings.definition: The study of human history before the development of writing.
meanings.sent1: Learning about prehistory helps us understand how early humans communicated before writing existed.
meanings.sent2: Prehistory involves analyzing artifacts and fossils to piece together the story of our ancestors.
meanings.sent3: My brother joked that he was a prehistory detective trying to crack the case of the missing alphabet.
meanings.sent4: Exploring prehistory is like reading a book written in invisible ink, where the clues are hidden in the past.
meanings.sent5: The field of prehistory is like a time machine that takes us back to a world without written words.
